description: Specifies whether to only allow new Appropriation Hierarchies in the request.

Appropriation_HierarchyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Appropriation_HierarchyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Appropriation_HierarchyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Appropriation_Hierarchy_Data.description: The Name of this Appropriation Hierarchy.
The Reference ID of the Appropriation Hierarchy.
Specifies whether to Include the Appropriation Hierarchy ID in the display Name.
Specifies whether the Appropriation is Inactive.

Organization_SubtypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Organization_SubtypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Element Container for Appropriation Hierarchy Data.

validation.validation: You can't use an appropriation more than one time in an appropriation hierarchy. Either change the appropriation's parent or change the appropriation: [appropriations]
Specify Inactive as false if this Appropriation Hierarchy has any Appropriations or child Appropriation Hierarchies.
Specify an active Superior Appropriation Hierarchy.
Specify a Superior Appropriation Hierarchy that isn't a descendent of this Appropriation Hierarchy.
Specify a unique Appropriation Hierarchy Name.
To update an existing Appropriation Hierarchy, specify the original Appropriation Hierarchy Reference ID.
Specify a Superior Appropriation Hierarchy that's different from this Appropriation Hierarchy.
Specify valid Organization Subtype for Appropriation Hierarchies.
